result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Austin Mirelez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Withheld sentence, 1 years of probation.  Report to Dept of Correction immediately upon release on 3/1/22.

miscConds.notes: $379 - If probation / supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
11:46AM - Defendant Michael Austin Mirelez in court, appearing in person in custody, with attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak (21CF410) and Atty Jamy Johansen (22CF25).  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Atty Pollak indicates agreement reached.    Plea Questionnaire submitted to Court.  State recites agreement, moving to amend Count 1 in 22CF25.  All parties agree with agreement as recited.  State indicates victim's rights compliance.  Court amends count 1 in 22CF25.  DEF enters plea of NC to count 1 in 21CF410 and amended count 1 in 22CF25.      DEF advised of rights and penalties; DEF waives rights; parties stipulate to facts in each case.  Court finds the DEF freely, voluntarily, and intelligently entered his pleas.  Court accepts pleas and finds DEF guilty of count 1 in 21CF410 and amended count 1 in 22CF25.  Court indicates count 2 in 21CF410 and all open traffic citations related are dismissed.  Atty Pollak indicates traffic citation case numbers are :  21TR969, 21TR970, 21TR971, 21TR972, 21TR973, 21TR974.  State makes a statement prior to sentencing, indicates victim's right compliance, asking Court to accept joint recommendation,.  Atty Pollak makes statement prior to sentencing in 21CF410, asking Court to accept joint recommendation, indicating 67 days of credit if revoked.  Court clarifies that credit applies to 21CF410 only.  Atty Johansen makes statement prior to sentencing in 22CF25, asking Court to accept joint recommendation.  DEF makes statement prior to sentencing.  Court addresses DEF on probation compliance, DEF responds, makes additional statement.  Court to follow agreement.    Court instructs DEF to provide DNA sample and to report to Dept of Correction immediately upon release on 3/1/22.

COURT:

21CF410 :
Count 1 = Withheld sentence, 3 years of probation.  Report to Dept of Correction immediately upon release on 3/1/22.  Credit of 67 days if revoked.  Conditions:    Complete any counseling, and programming deemed appropriate by agent, including AODA, and follow through.  Fine/costs:  $643, which includes DNA surcharge.  DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $250 surcharge.   If probation / supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Count 2 = Dismissed


22CF25:
Amended Count 1 = Withheld sentence, 1 years of probation.  Report to Dept of Correction immediately upon release on 3/1/22.  Conditions:    No contact with:  M.H.T. (dob: 4/14/1992).  Complete any counseling,  and programming deemed appropriate by agent, including AODA, and follow through.  Fine/costs:  $579, which includes DNA surcharge.  DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $200 surcharge.   If probation / supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

21TR969= Dismissed
21TR970= Dismissed
21TR971= Dismissed
21TR972= Dismissed
21TR973= Dismissed
21TR974= Dismissed
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt: 02:44 PM Defendant Michael Austin Mirelez in court with attorney Jamy Richard Johansen appears by zoom.  Defendant Michael Austin Mirelez in custody appears by video.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls case and recites appearances. DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.   State makes bond recommendation.   Attny Johnansen no objection.  Court sets bond.  SIBS $5000.   Through Counsel DEF waives time limits for preliminary hearing.  Status conference scheduled for March 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
